result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jason Matthews

Defendant Jason Matthews in court.  
Attorney Patrick Kiernan Cafferty in court for Jason Matthews.  
Attorney Matthew Richard Westphal in court for State of Wisconsin. 

Case in court for a Scheduling Conference
Defense request a final pretrial and jury trial dates. 
Court ordered parties to file their Pretrial documents 48 hours in advance of the final pretrial hearing.
Case remains calendared in Branch 19.
Final pre-trial scheduled for January 12, 2023 at 09:00 am.
Jury trial scheduled for January 30, 2023 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Jason Matthews in court.  
Attorney Patrick Kiernan Cafferty in court for Jason Matthews.  
Attorney Matthew Richard Westphal in court for State of Wisconsin. 

Case in court for Scheduling Conference. 
Parties request an additional hearing advising the court they are still reviewing the voluminous discovery. 
Court ordered matter adjourned back to Branch 19.
Scheduling conference scheduled for October 17, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Jason Matthews in court with attorney Patrick Kiernan Cafferty.  Nicolas J Heitman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Case in court for Scheduling Conference. Defense requested Scheduling Conference. Case adjourned in Branch 45.
Pursuant to Chief Judge Directive 22-04, parties are hereby notified that as of July 30, 2022, this case will be assigned to Branch 6, Judge Ellen Brostrom, in Room 608 of the Courthouse.  Scheduling conference scheduled for September 9, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Jason Matthews in court with attorney Patrick Kiernan Cafferty.  Matthew Richard Westphal appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for a scheduling conference. Defense has al discovery. Defense requested an additional scheduling conference date. Court granted defenses request. Case adjourned to Branch 45.  Scheduling conference scheduled for July 7, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Demand for Discovery and Inspection, Filed.
records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: Request for Substitution of Judge received and filed.  Court consented to substitution against Judge Sanders.  Parties are advised the Clerk of Circuit Court reassigned case pursuant to current court rules to Judge Kies, Br. 45.

Defendant Jason Matthews in court with Attorney Patrick Kiernan Cafferty; both appear by video. Matthew Westphal appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Kies, Branch 45. Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty. Court ordered case adjourned for Scheduling Conference to Branch 45.  Scheduling conference scheduled for May 3, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Jason Matthews in court with Attorney Carl Johnson on behalf of Attorney Patrick Kiernan Cafferty.  Matthew Zisi appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  PARTIES APPEAR BY VIDEO.
Case set for a preliminary hearing. Defense requests an adjournment as Attorney Cafferty is unavailable. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 22, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Adjustment Number: 22A 017738,
Payable Number: 987138,
Receipt Number: 22RP007225,
Amount: $20.00
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with VerHalen, Inc. d/b/a Pella Windows and Doors and any employees of the company
Court ordered Justice Point Pretrial Services LEVEL 2 SUPERVISION.  Court reminders.

Defendant Jason Matthews in court with attorney Stephen Andrew Sargent.  Defendant Jason Matthews in custody.  Karine O'Byrne appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Jason Matthews appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Sanders, Branch 28. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS NOT INDIGENT.  This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for February 21, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
Arrest Warrant received from the D.A.'s office on filing date of Criminal Complaint.
